cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.SY. 

The paper is about multi-armed bandits, which is a well-established topic in machine learning and optimization. The focus is on providing an introductory treatment of the subject, which suggests that it is aimed at a broad audience, including students and researchers who are new to the field. The paper covers a range of topics, including stochastic bandits, Bayesian bandits, Lipschitz bandits, contextual bandits, and bandits with incentives, which suggests that it is relevant to several subfields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), game theory (cs.GT), and control systems (cs.SY).
